subject: Re: My Progress
msgSnippet: Thanks, Nathan and Tevel, for your kind words.  You asked for more, so here it comes. I ve written out in QS the lyrics to Time, from Dark Side of the Moon. I
messageBody:
Thanks, Nathan and Tevel, for your kind words.  You asked for more, so here it comes.

I've written out in QS the lyrics to Time, from Dark Side of the Moon. 

I took two small liberties with the official QS Manual's delineation of the alphabet.  First, I think Letter 24 ("L") should have a reversible form like Letter 23 ("N") does.  That way, you can connect an "L" from a letter ending on the upper parallel to a letter ending on the writing line as well as vice versa.  The alternate "L" I envision is the same as the standard "L" but reflected about a vertical axis.  Having both for flexibility and maximum connectivity, as we enjoy with the alternate "N", seems useful.  I've underlined in red the 3 places where I used the alternate "L".  In each case, I used it so I could connect with a following Letter 31.  Second, if "N" can be inverted for ease of connectivity, why not have the same freedom with Letter 21 ("NG")?  I underlined the single case where I used this, specifically to write the word "racing" with Letters 29, 11, and 21 all connected.  I would have had to do a penlift otherwise.

I'd love to hear your opinions on this type of minor extensions to the Standard.

                         Dave S
